001// Copyright (c) FIRST and other WPILib contributors.
002// Open Source Software; you can modify and/or share it under the terms of

004
005package edu.wpi.first.wpilibj.simulation;
006
007import static edu.wpi.first.units.Units.RadiansPerSecond;
008import static edu.wpi.first.units.Units.RadiansPerSecondPerSecond;
009
010import edu.wpi.first.math.VecBuilder;
011import edu.wpi.first.math.numbers.N1;
012import edu.wpi.first.math.system.LinearSystem;
013import edu.wpi.first.math.system.plant.DCMotor;
014import edu.wpi.first.math.system.plant.LinearSystemId;
015import edu.wpi.first.math.util.Units;
016import edu.wpi.first.units.Angle;
017import edu.wpi.first.units.Measure;
018import edu.wpi.first.units.MutableMeasure;
019import edu.wpi.first.units.Velocity;
020import edu.wpi.first.wpilibj.RobotController;
021
022/** Represents a simulated flywheel mechanism. */
023public class FlywheelSim extends LinearSystemSim<N1, N1, N1> {
024  // Gearbox for the flywheel.
025  private final DCMotor m_gearbox;
026
027  // The gearing from the motors to the output.
028  private final double m_gearing;
029
030  // The moment of inertia for the flywheel mechanism.
031  private final double m_jKgMetersSquared;
032
033  // The angular velocity of the system.
034  private final MutableMeasure<Velocity<Angle>> m_angularVelocity =
035      MutableMeasure.zero(RadiansPerSecond);
036
037  // The angular acceleration of the system.
038  private final MutableMeasure<Velocity<Velocity<Angle>>> m_angularAcceleration =
039      MutableMeasure.zero(RadiansPerSecondPerSecond);
040
041  /**
042   * Creates a simulated flywheel mechanism.
043   *
044   * @param plant The linear system that represents the flywheel. Use either {@link
045   *     LinearSystemId#createFlywheelSystem(DCMotor, double, double)} if using physical constants
046   *     or {@link LinearSystemId#identifyVelocitySystem(double, double)} if using system
047   *     characterization.
048   * @param gearbox The type of and number of motors in the flywheel gearbox.
049   * @param measurementStdDevs The standard deviations of the measurements. Can be omitted if no
050   *     noise is desired. If present must have 1 element for velocity.
051   */
052  public FlywheelSim(
053      LinearSystem<N1, N1, N1> plant, DCMotor gearbox, double... measurementStdDevs) {
054    super(plant, measurementStdDevs);
055    m_gearbox = gearbox;
056
057    // By theorem 6.10.1 of https://file.tavsys.net/control/controls-engineering-in-frc.pdf,
058    // the flywheel state-space model is:
059    //
060    //   dx/dt = -G²Kₜ/(KᵥRJ)x + (GKₜ)/(RJ)u
061    //   A = -G²Kₜ/(KᵥRJ)
062    //   B = GKₜ/(RJ)
063    //
064    // Solve for G.
065    //
066    //   A/B = -G/Kᵥ
067    //   G = -KᵥA/B
068    //
069    // Solve for J.
070    //
071    //   B = GKₜ/(RJ)
072    //   J = GKₜ/(RB)
073    m_gearing = -gearbox.KvRadPerSecPerVolt * plant.getA(0, 0) / plant.getB(0, 0);
074    m_jKgMetersSquared = m_gearing * gearbox.KtNMPerAmp / (gearbox.rOhms * plant.getB(0, 0));
075  }
076
077  /**
078   * Sets the flywheel's angular velocity.
079   *
080   * @param velocityRadPerSec The new velocity in radians per second.
081   */
082  public void setAngularVelocity(double velocityRadPerSec) {
083    setState(VecBuilder.fill(velocityRadPerSec));
084  }
085
086  /**
087   * Returns the gear ratio of the flywheel.
088   *
089   * @return the flywheel's gear ratio.
090   */
091  public double getGearing() {
092    return m_gearing;
093  }
094
095  /**
096   * Returns the moment of inertia in kilograms meters squared.
097   *
098   * @return The flywheel's moment of inertia.
099   */
100  public double getJKgMetersSquared() {
101    return m_jKgMetersSquared;
102  }
103
104  /**
105   * Returns the gearbox for the flywheel.
106   *
107   * @return The flywheel's gearbox.
108   */
109  public DCMotor getGearBox() {
110    return m_gearbox;
111  }
112
113  /**
114   * Returns the flywheel's velocity in Radians Per Second.
115   *
116   * @return The flywheel's velocity in Radians Per Second.
117   */
118  public double getAngularVelocityRadPerSec() {
119    return getOutput(0);
120  }
121
122  /**
123   * Returns the flywheel's velocity in RPM.
124   *
125   * @return The flywheel's velocity in RPM.
126   */
127  public double getAngularVelocityRPM() {
128    return Units.radiansPerSecondToRotationsPerMinute(getAngularVelocityRadPerSec());
129  }
130
131  /**
132   * Returns the flywheel's velocity.
133   *
134   * @return The flywheel's velocity
135   */
136  public Measure<Velocity<Angle>> getAngularVelocity() {
137    m_angularVelocity.mut_setMagnitude(getAngularVelocityRadPerSec());
138    return m_angularVelocity;
139  }
140
141  /**
142   * Returns the flywheel's acceleration in Radians Per Second Squared.
143   *
144   * @return The flywheel's acceleration in Radians Per Second Squared.
145   */
146  public double getAngularAccelerationRadPerSecSq() {
147    var acceleration = (m_plant.getA().times(m_x)).plus(m_plant.getB().times(m_u));
148    return acceleration.get(0, 0);
149  }
150
151  /**
152   * Returns the flywheel's acceleration.
153   *
154   * @return The flywheel's acceleration.
155   */
156  public Measure<Velocity<Velocity<Angle>>> getAngularAcceleration() {
157    m_angularAcceleration.mut_setMagnitude(getAngularAccelerationRadPerSecSq());
158    return m_angularAcceleration;
159  }
160
161  /**
162   * Returns the flywheel's torque in Newton-Meters.
163   *
164   * @return The flywheel's torque in Newton-Meters.
165   */
166  public double getTorqueNewtonMeters() {
167    return getAngularAccelerationRadPerSecSq() * m_jKgMetersSquared;
168  }
169
170  /**
171   * Returns the flywheel's current draw.
172   *
173   * @return The flywheel's current draw.
174   */
175  public double getCurrentDrawAmps() {
176    // I = V / R - omega / (Kv * R)
177    // Reductions are output over input, so a reduction of 2:1 means the motor is spinning
178    // 2x faster than the flywheel
179    return m_gearbox.getCurrent(m_x.get(0, 0) * m_gearing, m_u.get(0, 0))
180        * Math.signum(m_u.get(0, 0));
181  }
182
183  /**
184   * Gets the input voltage for the flywheel.
185   *
186   * @return The flywheel input voltage.
187   */
188  public double getInputVoltage() {
189    return getInput(0);
190  }
191
192  /**
193   * Sets the input voltage for the flywheel.
194   *
195   * @param volts The input voltage.
196   */
197  public void setInputVoltage(double volts) {
198    setInput(volts);
199    clampInput(RobotController.getBatteryVoltage());
200  }
201}
